result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd Michael Danner Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges.  If not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both.

Possess no firearms/weapons.
No contact with Power's Bar located at 1815 10th Avenue, South Milwaukee, WI. 53172.

Successfully complete a parenting class.
Participate in a Cognitive Thinking course.
AODA assessment deemed appropriate.  Absolute sobriety to be monitored by random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd Michael Danner Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Todd Michael Danner in court with attorney Ed Borda for Christopher R Smith.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court grants defense motion for an adjournment.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Todd Michael Danner in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda for Chris Smith.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pretrial conference conducted.  Parties have reached a resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered the signature bond that was previously signed in the county jail to continue. Signature bond is not in the file at this time.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Todd Michael Danner in court with attorney Christopher R Smith.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 24. Next court date is for 5-5-2015, at 8:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/17/15 @ 1:30pm
